sentence.text: The increased regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton-GTP results from AKT phosphorylating three serines (S298, S329, and S567) in the negative regulation of cell proliferation tumor suppressor, a G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway GTPase-activating protein (RhoGAP) associated with focal adhesions.

entity.text: regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton

sentence.text: That binding, which interferes with the interaction of regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton-GTP with the RhoGAP domain, reduces the hydrolysis of RhoA-GTP, the binding of other negative regulation of cell proliferation ligands, and the colocalization of DLC1 with focal adhesions and attenuates tumor suppressor activity.

entity.text: regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton

sentence.text: negative regulation of cell proliferation is a critical AKT target in negative regulation of cell proliferation-positive cancer because AKT inhibition has potent antitumor activity in the DLC1-positive transgenic cancer model and in a DLC1-positive cancer cell line but not in an isogenic DLC1-negative cell line

That binding, which interferes with the interaction of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathwayA-GTP with the G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathwayGAP domain, reduces the hydrolysis of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathwayA-GTP, the binding of other DLC1 ligands, and the colocalization of DLC1 with focal adhesions and attenuates tumor suppressor activity.
